results.title: News digest [No. 9]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Kyabram’s rodeo; 12,000 sea shells collected from the world’s beaches; Victoria’s first mobile water patrol equipped with a bar tender cruiser is launched at Sandringham; underwater enthusiasts collect relics from old steamers; movies on the move at the Myer Music Bowl shown by the State Film Centre on a 24 by 8 foot screen as part of the Moomba festivities.

results.title: News digest [No. 8]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Silent players at Benalla - headquarters of the Gliding Club of Victoria; antique pistols are shown by collectors of arms; a bullock team at work hauling timber at Yellingbo; an old Chinese market gardener on his daily round; and a student riding the monocycle he made.

results.title: News digest [No. 7]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Melbourne police patrol use bicycles at night to help prevent thefts; champion highland dancer demonstrates the Highland fling and sward dance as he teaches his pupils; the history of flight from Leonardo da Vinci to space travel; water skiers ingenuity at Quandong.

results.title: News digest [No. 6]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Champion wood chopper Jack O’Toole in action; attraction of Lake Eppalock for picnics, boating, water sports and trout fishing for all water sport enthusiasts; exhibition of historic locomotives; bumper wheat crop at Werrimul; newly discovered scallop beds in Port Phillip Bay.

results.title: News digest [No. 5]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Demonstrates the usefulness of a helicopter for fire-spotting, and foam for extinguishing a car fire; Streeton’s descendants open his old home to the public, show many paintings; Latrobe Valley Aero Club caters for country flyers; at Harcourt an old sailor remembers the past as he models sailing ships.

results.title: News digest [No. 4]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: “Parade of Champions” - Stockwell Stud, Diggers Rest annual open day to raise funds for Royal Children’s hospital with stallions parading at a racing stud, show the finer points of horse breeding. “Boatmen” - waterfront activities by dockworkers at the Melbourne Ports, retrieving lines from berthing ships do hazardous work. “Man of Metal” - Montsalvat, Eltham, sculptor using scrap-metal for works (Mackam Skipper) with his sister together design and execute metal screens for the National University. “Jungle Gym” - Bayswater Rotary Club provides elephant-like playground equipment.
results.description: Cinemagazine items include: “Parade of Champions” - Stockwell Stud, Diggers Rest annual open day to raise funds for Royal Children’s hospital with stallions parading at a racing stud, show the finer points of horse breeding. “Boatmen” - waterfront activities by dockworkers at the Melbourne Ports, retrieving lines from berthing ships do hazardous work. “Man of Metal” - Montsalvat, Eltham, sculptor using scrap-metal for works (Mackam Skipper) with his sister together design and execute metal screens for the National University. “Jungle Gym” - Bayswater Rotary Club provides elephant-like playground equipment.

results.title: News digest [No. 3]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Mechanized hiking in East Gippsland with a four-wheel drive vehicle which “swims” and makes its own road; infested trees are destroyed in the fight against the sirex wasp; business principles are taught and put into practice at Port Albert where children make and sell pottery; divers test their reactions and equipment under ice.

results.title: News digest [No. 2]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Crop-dusting aircraft help growers produce cotton near Robinvale; Dhurringile, a castle near Shepparton, is home to Scottish orphans who learn its history and help on the farm; the “Tambo Lady”, a 65-foot motor cruiser has a test run along the Latrobe River to Sale; young artists’ work displayed at the Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: News digest [No. 14]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “News digest”.
Magazine items: 14-day commando course in cliff-climbing and descents for a C.M.F. company; “Frostbite regatta” - hardy all year yachtsmen race in eight-foot sabots on Waranga Reservoir in Northern Victoria; “Four in one” - a Carlton Methodist church where the service may be followed in Spanish, Italian, Hungarian and English, thus assisting migrants’ integration; “Whirlybird weapon” - helicopters used to spray crops in the Mallee prove their reliability; “Bouncing Babies” - veteran cars prove their reliability during a lively car trial.
